<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story0BeginningDescription" value="Vy zachoŭvajecie pryjemnyja ŭspaminy pra dni, kali byli pracoŭnym na kańjonach Marsa i Technaakalitam na Fiekandyi. Decitar Kambre-Nieon byŭ z vami tady, z samaha pačatku jak pracoŭny paplečnik, potym jak ciełaachoŭnik, a zaraz jak vašy Skitaryj-Maršał. Jon padzialaŭ z vami misiju ŭ minułym stahodździ. Tamu, kali jon paćvierdziŭ, što pratakoły pakarańnia śmierciu narešcie zaćvierdžany i vypuščany, vy z nieciarpieńniem prystupili da pačatkovych etapaŭ.
Hetaja misija aznačała, što vy musili adsutničać na svaim pastu, pra što vam chutka napomniŭ Mahos Bieniedykt. Adsutničać padčas uvarvańnia Orkaŭ. Adsutničać padčas paćvierdžanych uciokaŭ Tyranidaŭ. Adsutničać padčas raskidvańnia siłaŭ Adeptus Miechanikus pa płaniecie, u tym liku kaštoŭnych Kaścielanaŭ. Adsutničać padčas pieraŭtvareńnia hanarlivaha Harada-Vulla Hładyus Prajma ŭ pusteču, na ruinach jakoj kieškajecca naŭrad ci miljard dušaŭ, a za astatnija bahaćci zmahajucca ŭsie Ksienasy i jeretyki.
Ale vy nia možacie tłumačyć Bieniedyktu. Vy musicie stavicca da svajoj misii tak, niby jana zychodzić ad Najvysokich Łordaŭ Tery ci Hienierała Fabrykatara. Sapraŭdy, Astra Militarum i Adeptus Astartes nia mohuć padtrymlivać vašyja dasledavańni Tyranidaŭ, a značyć, musiać stavicca da ich jak da varožych - nia kažučy ŭžo pra vašy kančatkovy płan."/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story0Stage1Description" value="Vy pryviali svaju astatniuju svitu Skitaryjaŭ u zakinuty horad-vullej, jaki stanie hruntam vašaj kuźni. Vy abrali hetaje miesca nie vypadkova - u jaho sercy znachodzicca staražytny karkas Tytanu, pakinuty tut u časy zavajovy płaniety. Kali jaho ažyvić, jon budzie niastrymnym. Vy daručajecie Bieniedyktu sačyć za jaho rekanstrukcyjaj.
Bieniedykt-Mahos Hierantakrat, Bieniedykt Sačierdas Kvo-Vadzis, kali kazać jaho poŭnaje imio, vyklikaje turbotu. Vy padazravpiecie jaho nie łajalnaść z momantu paŭstańnia na Ununicyi IV. Tam, u momant vašaha tryumfu nad jeretykami-kultystami, jany skazali štości takoje na emocyjach. Vy b pazbavilisia ad uspaminaŭ, ale ich dazvoły supadajuć z vašymi, bolš za toje, vierahodna, jany niejkim čynam pierasiahajuć vašyja.
“Archimahos, zapyt. Treba pamnažeńnie vytvorčaści. Adzin, Manufaktorum Kibiernetyka, proksimici dva, efiektyŭnasć vytvorčaj linii. Uchvaleńnie?”"/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story1Stage1Description" value="U niekrasparyumach Hienietara čakanyja trupy Orkaŭ. Ale Tyranidy… jany ŭžo prystasoŭvajucca. Sapraŭdy, vy bačycie, “miortvaha“ chormahaŭnta źniščanaha padčas pahłynańnia vialikaj častki servitara. Heta tryvožna. Vašaja stratehija različana na toje, što jany nia majuć miascovaha Rozumu Vulla, ale, zdajecca, jany ŭžo vyhadavali štości takoje ŭ popiełavych adkidach. Kali b vašaja misija była inšaj, to heta było b katastrofaj.
Bieniedykt uvachodzić. “Ekskursija tyranidaŭ raŭnaznačna pravału. Vašaja adsutnaść, vašy pravał. Zručna/niazručna. Patrabujecca palapšeńnie. Raśśledavańnie sankcyjanavana. Tak kažuć Usie.” Ich insinuacyi prafiltroŭvajucca praz infarmacyjnyja sietki, dalikatna źmianiajuć vašy dostup, vy adčuvajecie, jak zvužajucca vašyja kanały siłkavańnia i słabieje vašy kantrol, kali vašyja paplečniki Mahi zhadžajucca z bojaziami Bieniedykta.
Adsutnaść łajalnaści Bieniedykta turbuje vas. Jon zdradnik ci prosta ambicyjny? Toj vyblisk nianaviści i radaści, jakija jon prademanstravaŭ na Ununicyi IV, našmat pierasiahajuć čakanyja normy. Vy nikoli nie znachodzili dosyć dadzienych, kab zrabić vysnovu, ale zaraz bačycie sposab atrymać pierakanaŭčyja dovady - mahčyma, hetaje pavieličeńnie karelacyjnaha ŭniosku pryviadzie da taho, što Bieniedykt pierabiare i dapamoža vam ekstrapalavać adčuvalnyja i padachoŭnyja dadzienyja?
Tamu vy abaviazvajeciesia pravieści niezaležnaje raśsledavańnie vyblisku, adkryć pratakoły i zapisy dla ŭsieahulnaha ahladu i pryniać vyniki. Bieniedykt kivaje, prymaje prapanovu i moŭčki sychodzić. Infarmacyjnyja sietki znoŭ słabiejuć pa miery pašyreńnia vašaha abiacańnia.
Prahały ŭ łahičnych šlachach chutka robiacca vyjaŭnymi, što pryvodzić da bolš detalovaha dasledavańnia histaryčnych pratakołaŭ. Čamu vyvučeńnie Tyranidaŭ było sankcyjanavana ŭ Śviecie-Vulli, kali ryzyki takoha pačynańnia byli vielmi vyjaŭnyja navat na hruncie bazavych raźlikaŭ? Čamu strymlivańnie paciarpieła niaščaście? Samaje cikavaje, što niekalki staražytnych Kaścielanaŭ i ichnich Kavalej Dadzienych vyžyli paśla praryvu, ale adchilili vašyja kamandy.
Z hetaha vy pačniocie svajo rassledavańnie."/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story2BeginningDescription" value="Technažrecy ašukancy maŭčać, nie maje značeńnia jakuju techniku vykarystaŭ Bieniedykt (mietad mnostva i časta… biantežyć). Ale vivisiekcyja ich kahitataraŭ pakazała, što zahady sychodzili z samaha Marsa i supiarečyli vašym instrukcyjam. Tyranidy byli stvorany tut nie dla dasledavańnia słabych miescaŭ, jak na Fiekandyi, a jak spraŭnaja abarona - zbroja apošniaha srodku.
Jak niechta moh dadumacca da idei vykarystoŭvańnia brudnych Ksienasaŭ takim čynam? Dumka pra ŭtrymańnie hetych stvareńniaŭ, a tym bolš kantralavańnie, była nieprazorlivaj. Ekspłuatacyja Tyranidaŭ suprać samaj płaniety? Ci suprać tych, chto imkniecca jaje zavajavać? Nierazvažnaja, razburalnaja zaduma, kali heta praŭda. Što tut moža zdarycca takoje? Čamu Ziamla žadaje hetak mocna źniščeńnia. Navošta ryzykavać novym Fłotam Vulla na Impierskim Śviećcie-Vulli? I čamu heta było ŭtojena ad vas? Vam zdradziŭ Mars?
(Bieniedykt byŭ aśviadomleny?)"/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story2Stage1Description" value="Kali vy ŭvachodzicie ŭ archivy kuźni, Bieniedykt vychodzić. Čamu jon maje hetkija dazvoły? Vy ich amal nia majecie! Jon kivaje i kaža, kali vy prachodzicie pablizu: “Vulej zakinuty, ale nie pusty. Bank dadzienych Tytanu aktyŭny. Lehia Vienatar. Adkryćci, sakrety… Ksienasy. Staražytnyja ksienasy. Paralelnaje rassledavańnie. Chutkaje viartańnie. Dabrasłavieńnie Amnisii.”
Vy radyja jaho sychodu, ale vas turbuje, što jon moh znajści u pamiaci Tytanu. Što hetaja staražytnaja mašyna mahła ŭbačyć tut, pierš čym jaje zakinuli?"/> <entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story2EndingDescription" value="Bieniedykt viartajecca. Jon nie spyniŭsia, kab ačyscicca ad svaich bitvaŭ, nakiravaŭsia prama da vas, aŭhmientacyi dahetul dymiacca biaskolernymi vantrobami: “Zasada T'aŭ. Efirny lidar sa šnaram. Zachopleny… pamior moŭčki. Dadzienych niama. Nijakaj jerasi…” (Niaŭžo jon… uśmichajecca?) “Pravał paralelnaha rassledavańnia. Moj pravał. Vybačeńni.” I jon sychodzić, jaho Skitaryi - sledam.
Ničoha? Jon ničoha nie znajšoŭ?! Hetaha nia moža być. Bolš za toje, vy nie daviarajecie ni jamu, ni jaho ŭsmiešcy. Zaraz vy razumiejecie, što nikoli nia budziecie jamu daviarać. Vy musicie jaho prybrać."/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story3Stage1Description" value="Vy tajemna pasyłajecie svaich novych pamahatych u miescy, jakija naviedvaŭ Bieniedykt, ale ničoha nie znachodzicie - bolš za toje, ich niaŭmiełyja dopyty miascovych vyžyłych tolki pryciahvajuć da vas uvahu bujnych siłaŭ Ciomnaha Miechanikus. Ci byŭ Bieniedykt u zmovie z imi?
Jany ŭjaŭlajuć saboju raznašersnuju zborniu, ale vy chutka razumiejecie, što ich nielha niedaaceńvać. Prychodzić kom, vy adciahnuty dumkami pra jeraś Bieniedykta, vy aŭtamatyčna pačynajecie jaho rasšyfroŭvać. Jašče adna pamyłka. Kryk mašynnaha koda praryvajecca praz vašaje słužeńnie i vyvodzić z ładu vašyja siły. Jany majuć Kavala Varpu, vidavočna, vieteran Technapiech Doŭhaj Vajny…
Vašyja sistemy paškodžany, hlučać z-za nakładzienaha paviedamleńnia Kavala: “Boh Mašyna (2). zdradnikzdradnikzdradnik. Sardečna zaprašaju --> Pały.” Vy pracujecie nad jaho ačyščeńniem. Jak napisana ŭ Kvestas Miechanikar: “Z vusnaŭ jeretykoŭ vychodziać tolki brudnyja vyparvańni. Adrežcie jazyk i budźcie čystyja.”
Vy zahadvajecie adrezać jazyk Kavalu Varpu, i vašyja vajary kidajucca na šturm."/> <entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story3EndingDescription" value="Kaval Varpu lažyć parezany siarod reštak svaich demaničnych ruchavikoŭ, jaho razdušany hołas dahetul šepča “…zdradnik…” Vy zahadvajecie źniščyć usie reštki jeretykoŭ, a Skitaryjaŭ adkaznych za hetaje ścierci ad manipuły z-za strachu zaražeńnia.
Paśla vašaha viartańnia Decitar Kambre-Nieon 7 schiliŭsia pierad vami. Jon vyjaviŭ, što Mahos Bieniedykt pakinuŭ horad sa šmatlikimi Skitaryjami i Mahami. Jon nie zmoh umiašacca z-za pieravahi Mahosa ŭ ijerarchii Kuźni.
“Mahos, jon zdradziŭ vam, jakija b ni byli jaho pryčyny. I jon nakiravaŭsia da tych, chto nia moža viedać pra našuju misiju - Astra Militarum i Adeptus Astartes. My pavinny padnačalić ich usich, kab praduchilić raspaŭsiudžvańnie jerasi” - z hetym nielha nie pahadzicca, ale heta ŭžo krok napierad."/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story4BeginningDescription" value="“…Archimahos jeretyk. Fiekandyja, Mars, Hładyus i hetak dalej. Dokazy prykładzieny. Ekstremalnaja DEVIJACYJA…” Paviedamleńnie zacyklajecca, iznoŭ i znoŭ. Bieniedykt ścviardžaje, što vy płanujecie nievierahodnyja złačynstvy i što Prakuratar musić być pasłany dla rasledvańnia VAŠAJ spravy. Jon śćviaržaje, što vy złučanyja z praryvam ab'jekta Tyranidaŭ.
Mana! Usio mana! Vy addanyja Amnisii! Było b var'jactvam vypuskać Tyranidaŭ dzie b jany nie byli. Dziela biaśpieki vy błakujecie pieradačy ŭ miežach vaładarstvaŭ Miechanikus. Ale vy radyja, što jon zrabiŭ pieradaču."/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story4Stage1Description" value="Łazutčyki vyjavili Bieniedykta. Vyśvietliłasia dva klučavyja fakty. Pieršaje, jon rychtujecca źbiehčy na arbitu z klučavym artefaktam, uziatym u Astra Militarum - staražytnaj pryładaj, jakaja maje peŭny rovień kantrolu nad varp-štormami - što, uvohule, samo pa sabie cikava, i heta toje, što vy mahli b z tryumfam dastavić na Mars, kali b toje było vašaj metaj. Ale jon moža izalavać vas, kali dabiarecca da arbity.
Druhoje - vy naŭprost nia majecie abłohavaj zbroi dla šturmu Krepaści. Adnak šlachietnyja naščadki Kvestorys Miechanikus čakajuć vašych zahadaŭ. Vy ŭpeŭnieny, što adzin Impierski Rycar całkam razniasie hetuju krepaść."/> <entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story4EndingDescription" value="Krepasć Kosmapiechaŭ zrujnavana. Škada, što stvareńni Impieratara stračany tak marna, chacia jany i nie z'jaŭlalisia sapraŭdnymi słuhami Amnisii. I, što bolš važna, Bieniedyktu ŭdałosia vyratavacca, chacia jon i pakinuŭ svoj artefakt u ruinach Aptekaryjona.
Ale zaraz vy majecie fajły, z jaho dadzienymi pra płanietu. Niedarečnaje hłupstva, aktyŭnaja technałohija Ekzadytaŭ, ubudavanaja ŭ płanietu, jak i artefakt, na jaki vy źvierniecie ŭvahu, kali śviet stanie vašym. Ale voś toje, što vy šukali - Adeptus Astartes padazraje, što askiepak K'tana Ašukanca schavany niedzie ŭ šerahach Astra Militarum. Narešcie, vašaja meta! Heta toje, što Amnisija pasłała vas znajści i zachapić."/>
<entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story5Stage1Description" value="Ašukaniec vajavaŭ dobra. Paźniej, praz šmat času paśla skančeńnia bitvy. Vy zaprašajecie Decitara Kambre-Nieon 7 na ruiny horada Kosmapiechaŭ, dzie možacie pabyć u adzinocie, dzie možacie pazłaradničać. Vy čujecie, jak jon uvachodzić u razburany Aptekaryjon, i honar pierapaŭniaje vašyja pratakoły strymanaści. Vy ab'jaŭlajecie, što dastavili aśkiepak Ašukanca Amnisii!
“Pytańnie!>? Amnisii?! JERETECH.” - zajaŭlaje sucišnym hołasam. Niejkim čynam, heta nie Decitar, a Bieniedykt. Vy sprabujecie adharadzicca ad jaho, padać sihnał dapamohi, ale vašyja kamandy zastajucca biez adkazu - jaho dazvoły pieravyšajuć vašyja. Vy smutna adčuvajecie, što jon zmoh zachapić vašy horad, nie papiaredziŭšy vas, nie zrabiŭšy nivodnaha strełu.
Kali vašy Skitaryj (zaraz užo Bieniedykt) uvachodzić, vy adčuvajecie, jak jon biare pad kantrol navat vas - vašyja miechaničnyja častki adklučajucca, vašy staražytnyja čałaviečyja orhany nia mohuć padtrymlivać vas, ciemra stulvajecca vakoł vas…
…i ŭ ciemry vy adčuvajecie, jak Amnisija ŭvachodzić, nadzielenaja mocaj. Chvała, chvała, chvała.
Zamknionyja ŭ svaim pamirajučym ciele, u svajoj sviadomaści vy bačycie razburany Aptekaryjon, napoŭnieny statyčnymi aliłujami. Vy adčuvajecie radaść, jak jaho cieła (Žyvy mietał? Chityn? Viasiołkavy ichor? Čorny kamień, što treskajecca ŭ jaho sladach?) usio pranosicca nad vami. Vy ŭžo nia viedajecie, ci adbyvajecca heta ŭ vašaj pamirajučaj sviadomaści ci ŭ realnaści, ale vy hatovyja paklascisia, što kryki inšych realnyja. Vielmi realnyja.
Paźniej, dumajecie vy, heta budzie paźniej. Vy schilajeciesia pierad svajoj spadaryniaj, ratavańnicaj čałaviectva, vašaj Amnisijaj. Vy amałodžany, vy znoŭ kantralujecie situacyju. Usio tak jasna, vy ŭsie razumiejecie.
(Vy ašukany?) Zaraz vy viartajeciesia ŭ karkas Tytanu, vašy najvialiki darunak joj, kab kiravać hetym śvietam pa jaje zahadzie."/> <entry name="AdeptusMechanicus/Story5EndingDescription" value="Pamyłki byli zrobleny. Bieniedykt byŭ hetak blizki da taho, kab zdradzić vam, zdradzić Impieryumu, zdradzić Amnisii. Ale Amnisija ŭsio daruje. (Toje realna?)
Atrymaŭšy moc ad aśkiepka Ašukanca, vy razam z Amnisijaj abudžajecie duchi mašyny Tytanu. (Vy śpicie?) Tytan robić krok napierad, strasajučy horad-vullej sa svaich plačej. Vašaja zavajova Hładyusa Prajma pačynajecca tut…"/>
<entry name="AstraMilitarum/Story0BeginningDescription" value="Hładyus Prajm zdavaŭsia vydatnym miescam dla Impierskaha administratara-sieńjora. Z jaho bahatymi resursami i stratehičnym miescavańniem. Kiravać im było lohka i prestyžna. Dla tutejšych žyćcio išło svaim paradkam da dnia, kali z nieba zvalilisia zapalenyja kasmičnyja stancyi płaniety i spuścilisia Orki, za jakimi rušyli ŭśled bolš žachlivyja Ksienasy. Miascovy padzieł Kosmapiechaŭ stajaŭ mocna, ale ledź trymaŭsia.
Jak Kamandujučy siłami Astra Militarum, vy vysadzilisia na płanietu niekalki miesiacaŭ tamu, ale z-za niečakanaha paŭtornaha z'jaŭlennia płanietarnych varp-štormaŭ, vy apynulisia ŭ pastcy na pavierchni. Vy pierahrupavali vyžyłych hramadzianskich i vajaroŭ Astra Militarum u adzin horad, ale sałdaty dahetul raskidany za ścienami. My musim sabrać ich, adnavić našyja harady i advajavać hetuju płanietu. Za Impieratara!"/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story0BeginningDescription" value="Za dziesiać tysiač hadoŭ vajny vy nie pamiatajecie žachliviejšaha znachodžańnia ŭ Varpie. Paśla 13-ha Čornaha Kryžovaha Pachodu Abbadona ŭ dni paśla padzieńnia Kadyi vašy krejsier skoknuŭ u Varp i zachras tam, jak asa ŭ burštynie.
Čas staŭ nienadziejnym. Varp zaražaŭ vašy ekipaž i sam karabiel apantanaściu i mutacyjami, pakul cełaj nie zastałasia tolki kupka vašych vajaroŭ. Kali krejsier narešcie vydraŭsia z varpu nad Impierskim śvietam Hładyus Prajm, jon staŭ karablom-demanam, a vašyja acalełyja vajary ŭciakli na płanietu ŭnizie.
Ale paśla stolkich tysiačahodździaŭ vy viedajecie, što heta mieła sens. Vas vypraboŭvali i vy vyžyli. Vy viedajecie, što Ciomnyja Bahi mieli pryčynu pasłać vašu vajskovuju bandu na Hładyus Prajm, i što vy pavinny zrazumieć jaje ci sustreć ich hnieŭ."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story0Stage1Description" value="Uličvajučy vašyja namahańni, Paradžeńnie Chaosu naŭrad ci było tym dabrasłavieńniem, na jakoje vy različvali. Heta pačvara, jakaja biaskonca kurčycca, niekali była vašym Majstram Pakarańniaŭ Śmierciu. Zaraz jana prykuta łancuhami ŭ vašaj budovie, skrukavanaja razvalina, jakaja ledź vyžyvaje pad dziejańniem mutacyj, što razdzirajuć jaje na častcy i adnaŭlajuć ad imhnieńnia da imhnieńnia.
Rozumu vašaha spadarožnika bolej nie isnuje. Ale sa svaich šmatlikich vusnaŭ jon vymaŭlaje praroctvy. “…tysiačny mieč, łancuh zavieršany, bahi ŭ zhodzie, biaskoncaść zaražana…” Vašyja kultysty tłumačać jaho słovy jak papiaredžańnie pra napad Impieryi, ale ŭśled za hetym - ab'javieńnie."/> <entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story0EndingDescription" value="Prykuty da vašaha trona deman-svajak vyje, abviaščajučy pra prybyćcio. U vašyja pakoi ŭvachodzić źmienlivy Enijoch, vašy Majstar Apantanaści. Jaho familjary šaptalisia z momantu prybyćcia na płanietu i zaraz kažuć pra vialikija pierspiektyvy dla płaniety, dla kožnaha Łorda, jakomu chopić sił zachapić jaje. “Dahadzicie čatyrom Baham” - šypić šmathałosy Enijoch: “I jany zrobiać hetuju płanietu prydatnym domam dla Demana-Prynca.”
Hetaja płanieta, u niejkim sensie, jaki vy nie imknieciesia spaścihnuć, žyvaja. Z dapamohaj Enijocha i pad viadzieńniem bahoŭ vy voźmicie jaje - i, mahčyma, uzniasieciesia da Demanstva."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story1BeginningDescription" value="U vašych pakojach niama lusterkaŭ. Kali bahi ŭpieršyniu bahasłavili vas mutacyjaj, vy pabili ich usie ŭva svajoj hanarystaści. Ale ramy zastalisia, kab napaminać vam pra taho, kim vy stali.
Pakul vy siadzicie ŭ adzinocie, razvažajučy nad nie vartymi davieru słovami Enijocha, pustyja ramy zapaŭniajucca miasistym vokam Tziinča, jakoje biaskonca paŭtarajecca, razlivaje trypafobiju pa płastalovych ścienach. Nieŭzabavie z kožnaj ściany na vas hladzić pilny abraz Boha, stvorany z płoci."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story1EndingDescription" value="Vy lanotna pravodzicie palcam pa jaje vačnicach. Viadźmarka dobra pasłužyła svajoj mecie, navat kali jana była mimavolnaj achviaraj. Vy spadziajeciesia, što Tziinču pryjdziecca da hustu duša svajho prychilnika.
Jaje čerap ažyvaje ŭ vašaj ruce z palčatkaj i šepča hołasam Źmieńnika: “Vašy vyklik… intryhuje. Hetaja płanieta maje serca. Vy musicie źmianić jaho rytm na svoj ułasny.” Vy ŭśmichajeciesia, rasciskajučy čerap. Heta dobry pačatak."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story2BeginningDescription" value="Majstar Apantanaści znoŭ z'jaŭlajecca ŭ vašych pakojach. Enijoch uvachodzić biez šlema, i navat jon, zdajecca, na imhnieńnie adchisnuŭsia ad vačej, jakija nazirajuć sa ścienaŭ, ad rascisnutaha čerapa ŭ vašaj ruce. Vy pieradajocie paviedamleńnie Tziinča, i jon chitra ŭśmichajecca.
“Vydatna. Adzin z bahoŭ na našym boku, moj Łord, viadoma, nakolki lha daviarać Źmieńniku” - jon uvažliva hladzić u pilnyja vočy na ścianie: “Našaja nastupnaja pierspiektyva bolš. Łahodnaja. I bolš vidavočnaja ŭ svaich žadańniach. Usio, što nam treba zrabić, heta šyryć chvaroby ad jaho imia, i my, biez sumnievu, atrymajem jaho dabrasłavieńnie.” Voka raptam ahalaje zuby daŭžynioj u calu i hyrkaje na Enijocha, pierš čym jon rasciskaje jaho kułakom."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story3BeginningDescription" value="Enijoch staić ŭ vašych pakojach, kali vy viartajeciesia, u supravodzie fihury, ubranaj u technałohiju. Jana ahladaje vokavuju ścianu, prahniłuju i zaražanuju. Nie paśpiavaje novaja fihura paviarnucca, jak jaje miechatendryły i zbroja nacelvajucca na vas. Značyć, kaval.
Enijoch kaža: “Dva bahi na našym boku. Nastupny vyklik samy prosty. Usio čaho jon žadaje, viadoma”. Jon pakazvaje žestam na ścianu, dzie hnojnyja vočy ŭžo ściakajuć kryvioju. Jany pačynajuć fantanavać. Niby pavodka. Chutka pakoi zapaŭniajucca. Deman-svajak u vašaha trona panikuje, kali kroŭ padymajecca ŭharu. Kroŭ… zialonaja?"/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story3Stage1Description" value="Vy pryjšli pahladzieć, jakija novyja žachi stvaryŭ Ciomny Miechanikum napiaredadni napadu na Orkaŭ. Ale zamiž hetaha Kaval Varpu, zdajecca, vyrašyŭ pravieści dla vas ekskursiju pa svaim Piakielnym Fabrykataru. Jaho płoskaja mašynnaja mova tłumačyć toje, što musiła być biazbožnickimi žachami, rasčaroŭvajučy i stamlajučy vas. Paśla taho, jak jon z honaram prezientavaŭ treciuju identyčnuju stancyju dla mučeńnia dušy i łoŭli demanaŭ, vy schapili jaho za kipciury i prycisnuli da siabie.
“Mnie ŭsiaroŭna” - raviacie vy: “Kchornu ŭsiaroŭna. Nurhłu ŭsiaroŭna. Usim ŭsiaroŭna. Zialonaskuryja musiać pamierci! Buduj bolej demaničnych mašyn! Ci-” Jon kivaje, abyjakava, i sychodzić na svaich miechatendryłach.
Chutka vy budiecie mieć siły, kab źniščyć Zialonaskurych."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story3EndingDescription" value="Vašaja svita staić na ŭstupie, adkul adkryvajecca vid na łahier Orkaŭ. Ruchaviki demanaŭ dahetul radasna pierasledujuć małalikich Zialonaskurych, jakim paščasciła niepamierci ci nieźnieprytomić. Paŭsiul kroŭ, jana ściakaje i sačycca ŭ Bajcoŭskija Jamy.
Pravadyr Orkaŭ dahetul sprabuje paŭzci da vas, navat z adarvanymi kancavinami. Orki sapraŭdy vielmi žyvučyja. Vy ŭzdychajecie, ciahnieciesia ŭniz i adsiakajecie jamu hałavu. Hałava praciahvaje sprabavać ukusić vas za ščykałatki, pakul Enijoch nie šturchaje jaje ŭ łužynu kryvi. Pakul hałava Orka tonie i vykrykvaje prostyja pahrozy, z kryvi farmujecca demaničny rot, jaki prahłynaje hałavu i lamantuje: “KROŬ DLA KRYVAVAHA BOHA”, paśla čaho rot razvalvajecca. Zdajecca, Kchorn uchvalaje nas."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story4BeginningDescription" value="Ci baiciesia vy viartacca ŭ svaje pakoi? Moža, bahi hulajuć z vami, a nie abirajuć dla ŭźniasieńnia? Nie, vy - Łord Chaosu, i nia majecie inšaha vybaru, aproč jak iści dalej - adstupać, značyć patrabavać sparadžeńnie typu Majstra Pakarańniaŭ Śmierciu. Toje słovy Enijocha, jaki supravadžaje vas.
Vy ŭvachodzicie ŭ pakoj. Zała doŭhaja i cichaja. Vočy dryžać, ale začynieny. Padłoha čystaja ad kryvi i hnoju. Navat vašy žudasny deman-svajak vyhladaje cełym i varkoča. Usio *zanadta* łahodna.
Nieŭzabavie vy razumiejecie čamu. Deman siadzić na vašym tronie. Vašaje serca łović. Uvasableńnie pryhažości. Alebastravaja skura, pieraliŭny chityn, vočy, ahranienyja niby kaštoŭnymi kamianiami. Vy zmahajeciesia za kantrol nad jaho vodaram, ablizvajecie pierasochłyja vusny, ŭbačyŭšy eratyčny vyhin jaho niemažlivych kipciuroŭ. Pakul vy zmahajeciesia z saboj, vočy na ścianie adkryvajucca, skryŭlajuć jazyki, kancaviny i orhany, bo prahnuć vašaha dakranańnia."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story4EndingDescription" value="Vy nie ŭpeŭnieny, ci navučyli vy Niekronaŭ kachać, ale peŭna navučyli ich pakutavać. Zavableńnie ich biazdušnych ciełaŭ u pastku, kab jany nie zmahli vybracca, ekspierymientavańnie z katavańniami i žachami, nazirańnie za razrazańniem Kavalom Varpu ich cieła dla stymulavańnia centraŭ zadavalnieńnia… da hetaha dnia vy b nie skazali, što zmožacie prymusić Niekrona tak pakutavać, nie zmožacie źvieści Niekrona z rozumu ad jurlivaści.
Vy adčuvajecie, jak ciažkaja rakapadobnaja klušnia kładziecca na vašaje plačo, i vas achaplaje pryliŭ jurlivaści. A haračy hołas šepča vam na vucha: “Vinšuju, maleńki Łord”."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story5BeginningDescription" value="Pryhatavańni zrobleny. Usie bahi prasihnalizavali pra svaju prychilnaść da vas (i nie tolki na ścienach vašych pakojaŭ). Zaraz nastaje vašy momant.
Vy vyklikajecie prychilnaść kožnaha boha pa čarzie - Kchorna, Tziinča, Nurhła, Słaaneša. Pa ŭsioj pavierchni płaniety ich pahanaj siłaj nakresleny vialiki znak Chaosu, jaki achaplaje łancuh biaskoncaści ŭ jadry płaniety."/>
<entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story5Stage1Description" value="Ciapier rytuał pačynajecca sur'jezna. Majstar Apantanaści i Kaval Varpu viedajuć, što rabić. Arkannyja miechanizmy Kavala Varpu naładžvajucca na piłony i łancuhi płaniety, a Enijoch zahadvaje kultystam adpravicca ŭ kožnuju kropku zorki. Praz kroŭ i hrubuju hłybokuju pašanu vy skončycie rytuał i zarazicie staradaŭniuju abaronu Staražytnych.
Narešcie durni Impieryuma uśviadomili vašuju prysutnaść. Ale ci nie nadta pozna?"/> <entry name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Story5EndingDescription" value="Usio adbyvajecca adnačasna. Pierakručany tvar Enijocha rassypajecca ŭ pył, navat kali jon zaklikaje bahoŭ. Skryŭleńnie pahłynaje Demana-Prynca, fijaletavaje połymia spalvaje kultystaŭ, što molacca, a Kavala Varpu zaciahvaje ŭ svoj arkanny miechanizm, jaki tarkoča 1 i 0. Vyžyli tolki vy, źniamiełyja ŭ bury.
Niaščaście i viečnyja muki znachodziacca na adlehłaści adnaho imhnieńnia.
Ale paśla dziesiaci tysiač hadoŭ zmahańnia i žachu vy adčuvajecie dakranańnie bahoŭ da siabie. Z vašaj śpiny vyrastajuć ciomnyja kryły, vašyja kancaviny robiacca žachlivymi. Vy - novanarodžany Deman-Prync Chaosu Niepadzielenaha, jaki vyje, naradžajučysia ŭ pamirajučym śviecie.
Vašaja vola doŭžycca tolki siakundu. Rytuał zaciahvaje vas u jadro płaniety, pahłynajučy staražytnych duchaŭ, jakija chavajucca tam. Ciapier vy - sama płanieta, sapraŭdny śviet demanaŭ. Vašaja pahanaja prysutnaść ciahnie jaje i miljard jaje vyžyłych duš u Varp. Tam vy budziecie katavać ich viečnaść."/>
<entry name="Eldar/Story0BeginningDescription" value="Čornaja Rada Čornaj Biblijateki prysłała viestuna. Da nas, u našy izalavany Štučny Śviet. Maŭklivy Salitar raskłaŭ pierada mnoj čužyja karty, Impierskaje Taro. Impieratar. Tuz Miačoŭ.
To bok, Impierskaja kałonija, padumaŭ ja. Niby ŭ adkaz na maju dumku, Salitar raskłaŭ biezlič - amal ŭsiu kałodu, pieraplataja i zabłytvaja. Vajna, padumaŭ ja. Tatalnaja vajna.
Potym apošniaja trojka, na viaršyni kučy. Slapy Prazorca. I Vaładar Miačoŭ. Vieža Małanak. Cha, da heta ž ja sam - raśsiejana skazaŭ ja. A heta… što heta?
Pytajučy, ja vyrak siabie na zhubu. Usie maje surodzičy viedajuć, što nielha zadać pytańnie Salitaru i zastacca ŭ žyvych. Ale pytańni takoj važnaści patrabujuć adkazaŭ.
Tady my začynili vialikija bramy ŭ moj Štučny Śviet i ŭ moj rod. Salitar vystupaŭ tolki dla mianie, i ja daviedaŭsia pra Soty Mieč Vauła na Hładyusie Prajmie. Nitki losu, viadoma, pradrakali mnie smierć, ale davali nikčemny šaniec zajmieć Mieč, čym by jon ni byŭ. Heta było ŭ našych siłach i było varta majoj straty."/>
<entry name="Eldar/Story1EndingDescription" value="Aerl reported that the glyphs sealing the tomb were old—perhaps older even than the Aeldari—and that they called this world Anaris, that is ‘dawns light. In our stories, Anaris was the name of the Hundredth Sword of Vaul, wielded by the smith god of legend. “We came to find the sword.” said the Autarch, frowning. “But is this sword a planet or a prison or a weapon? Whatever, I long to wield it.”
It is hard to disentangle our history from myth. We believe that the Old Ones created us to defeat the soulless Necrons and Yngir—the Ctan. We also believe that the gods Isha and Kurnous bore us into this world and loved us. In our history, we know that our creation triggered the Enslaver plague and the death of the Old Ones. In our myths, we know that Khaine tried to destroy us because we threatened the gods.
Perhaps these events were the same events. Perhaps it was here that Vaul stood against Khaine, having bound this Necron tomb world in defeat. Perhaps it was here he himself was ‘bound to his anvil. The autarch found my reasoning specious, but we agreed that we must seize the blade before our enemies could."/>
<entry name="Eldar/Story2Stage1Description" value="Now that we had the devices it was clear that they are beyond our craft—they are impossibly perfect. From the few working ones we could ascertain that this planet is a prison. The Warp Storms are its bars, the sentinel devices are its guards. It was built to trap the Necrons. But it was more than that—we could see it was an oubliette too, housing something that needed to be forgotten. Who was it that was sealed here for 60 million years? Who was the guard, who the prisoner?
Whilst we investigated, the Necrons sensed our presence at their silent tomb and swiftly raised an army against us. The autarch led our forces, whilst I manipulated the ancient devices to our aid."/>
<entry name="Eldar/Story3Stage1Description" value="Something in the infinity circuit whispered to me. I was not used to how… unified it is. It felt like a single personality rather than the millions of souls I knew from a Craftworlds circuits. Perhaps sixty million years alone had amalgamated them… or it had always been alone. It had certainly become confused, tongue-tied… difficult.
Yet it told me slivers of its past. That it fought the necrons. That it defeated them, here. That the Old Ones lost because they lacked the ‘final sword. That Vaul was already bound. That a fragment of the god—Khaine—fell here and slept. That he needs waking to free the planet.
We determined to raise him from his slumber. But we first needed to deal with a nascent chaos threat, that was attempting to corrupt the infinity circuits themselves."/>
<entry name="Eldar/Story4Stage1Description" value="I was holding vigil outside the Shrine of Khaine, for the Avatar to emerge, communing with the infinity circuit again. A hand fell on my shoulder—the Solitaire. How strange to see them here. And then they melted into Aerl. Then into the Autarch, a human techpriest, a warpsmith, an Ork Mek… myself, bent beneath wisdom and years. Not-I smirked. In a voice that could swallow sun-spots, it leered. “Not wise to be alone, little Seer.”
For a moment, I was confused. Then I was lying on my side, rolled away from the melted Shrine doors. Kaela Mensha Khaine stood where I knelt, a hand of molten blood and metal grasping my double by its neck. It writhed, fought, melted in the Avatars grasp and a long twisted figure of golden energy was there, a wicked smile gracing a mocking Aeldari face, as it struggled with the bloody-handed god.
The war wasnt lost because of the sword. It was lost because the gods fought amongst themselves. And standing before us was the Jackal God, Cegorachs dark double, he who sows dissent. The Yngir or Ctan called Mephet'ran. The Deceiver. It fled then, a battle of immortal gods laying waste to the chambers, and the Avatar pursued it."/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story0BeginningDescription" value="As the proud leader of a Necrontyr dynasty, you'd never known defeat. Never, until your people met the Old Ones, and dared to attack their star-spanning empire. Your dynasty had been on the frontline when the war with the Old Ones started, and you were some of the first to face their wrath. Your Fringeworlds were scoured and your Coreworlds besieged for generations. When the C'tan called the Messenger—and now the Deceiver—promised your people immortality through biotransference into undying machine bodies, you snatched at it greedily. Later, you betrayed him and his kind, shattering them into C'tan shards now used as weapons.
To no avail, sadly. Though your new soulless bodies were nigh-indestructible, even as their empire collapsed the Old Ones encircled your crownworld and used their uncanny powers to trap you within it, driving their warp technology into its surface, binding you to the depths. You retreated to the underground stasis tombs that Szarekh, the Silent King, had ordered constructed, and waited for the final assault—which never came. Eventually, you slept, awaiting the Silent King's call.
Now, sixty million years have passed and you've awoken into… chaos. Signs of battle between the Old Ones' humanoid creations litter the surface, as do the ancient enemy's traps. These devastated your people upon awakening, leaving a few surviving tombs widely scattered. Through the warp storm, you can hear nothing from your overlord Szarekh.
Where are the Old Ones? Who won the war? Is this another trap? Where are your C'tan gods? We must investigate—cautiously."/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story1BeginningDescription" value="One of the tombs holds a Triarch Praetorian called Eystan—a Necron judge. However, he is not of our dynasty, but instead a traveller who became trapped here, long after our slumber began. He tells us that after we destroyed our C'tan gods at the orders of the Silent King, we were victorious in the War in Heaven, crushing the Old Ones. Afterwards we slept, weakened by battle.
In those dying days, Eystan's group had been dispatched into the webway to lead an invasion of Old One homeworlds—but he lost his way in the maze and became stranded on our world when the Webway collapsed. He forced his way into the tomb's entrance, but with no way to enter it proper, has spent sixty million years alone, listening to the waking galaxy. This obfuscating warp storm is a new phenomenon—he believes intended to trap us here."/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story2BeginningDescription" value="When we slew our star-gods, the Ctan, they didnt die easily. After all, they were fundamental parts of the universe who had achieved sentience—they couldnt be truly annihilated, only atomised and trapped, lest they re-coalesce. And some Ctan left a curse at the moment of their death, like Llandu'gors Flayer disease that drives so many of our warriors to madness.
The Destroyer Cults—which have sprung up on the peripheries of our cities too—are another reflection of the Ctans curse. These nihilists are drawn from the best of us—Immortals, Lychguard and Lords—and in their madness, seek only the death of all life.
But whilst we can communicate with our local cults, this maddened army is incommunicate and kills isolated Necrons alongside the living. We must stop them, if we can."/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story3BeginningDescription" value="Ptanotek, the Cryptek, has studied the warp storm and come to a conclusion—the Old One technology that maintains the storm is embedded in this planet. The machine that built it is surely here too. If we can find it, she's sure that she can reverse-engineer its technology, and perhaps dissipate the Warp Storm.
That might be harder than it sounds. For, in the intervening millennia, Aeldari, Man, Ork, Jokaero and stranger creatures have left their creations on your Crownworld's surface, and cannibalised the Old One's technology. Gather their artefacts for the Cryptek to study, and we may be able to find the mechanism by which to control the Old One machinery."/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story4BeginningDescription" value="Eystan has been gone only a short time, the mountainous artefact floating behind, when the Cryptek demands an audience. Her Scarabs enter en masse with her, prompting your Lychguard to gather about you defensively. Instead of conflict, though, the Scarabs bring something else.
Ptanotek explains her scarabs were exploring a long-destroyed Old One habitat, when they happened on some unusual remains. Before she could personally investigate, her scarabs were driven off by the Psychneuein which had infested the ruin.
But they did manage to recover one thing—she presents you with a Rod of Covenant, a traditional Praetorian weapon. One that absolutely should not have been in an Old One ruin. What is going on?"/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story5BeginningDescription" value="Eystan communicates with you—or, rather, the thing that pretended to be Eystan does. It is a transcendent shard of Mephet'ran, the Messenger, the Deceiver, the same C'tan who doomed your people to these metal bodies with its mellifluous lies. Around it stands a legion of your fellow Necrons, blank-eyed like the Destroyers you defeated before.
In Eystan's tortured voice, Mephet'ran gloats that you have handed it the keys to the Old One's technology, and invites you to submit to your ancient masters. You cut off the communication in despair.
Your Cryptek has her own secrets, however. From a hidden stasis tomb, a Spyder raises a cherished gift from the Silent King, saved from the days of rebellion—an Aeonic device explicitly made to kill a C'tan. If we can recover the control device and use the Old One and Silent King's technology side by side, we can crush this hubristic C'tan.
And once we've shown the other races of this planet that we can crush even a Star God, surely they will fall in line too."/>
<entry name="Necrons/Story5EndingDescription" value="The Cryptek deploys her Aeonic weapon, and the thing that killed Eystan one moment screams incoherently and the next whimpers, its incomprehensible intelligence splintered a hundred-fold into Tesseract Vaults under your command.
Knowing now that Eystan was The Messenger, you know that everything he told you was almost certainly a lie—his tales of the war in heaven, the fall of the Old Ones and so on. After all, to think that the Necrons could have defeated both the Old Ones and the Ctan is beyond comprehension.
So, beyond the warp storm, the Old Ones doubtless still rule—but here, you shall stay safe inside this defensive tempest they have so kindly created. This shall remain a true planet of the Necrons, with you ruling over these mortal slaves until such day as you are strong enough to challenge the galaxy once again."/>
<entry name="Orks/Story2BeginningDescription" value="You're standing on a hilltop, watching a Mek kicking an engine the size of a Hive block. The aeons-old space hulk that brought you to this planet was grounded by the warp storm and terribly damaged. Your few remaining Meks are putting their heads together to fix it, hoping that you can get off-planet and continue your Waaagh! away from this murderous storm. Because, as Bonez said, “Even Orks can't fight da sky!” As you watch, the Mek's banging triggers something it shouldn't. The giant engine suddenly hiccups, flash-frying him and a nearby herd of Squigs.
You're gnawing on your fourth flambeed Squig when Wurrrdred and his entourage bring the good news. They've found the Gork and Mork gubbins—sort of."/>
<entry name="Orks/Story4BeginningDescription" value="The ancient engine bitz look incongruously tiny and insignificant when welded to the edge of your giant hulk, but the Meks, learning from their mistakes, are taking no risks. A lone grot is dispatched to hammer on the engines, in the hope of triggering them. As he strikes his first blow, the ancient devices tremble and inch the hulk clear of the ground. The grot's cheers are curtailed by the hulk slamming back down, atomising him in the blast wave.
Standing on a distant hilltop, you get back on your feet with a big grin on your face—your Waaagh! isn't going to end on this mudball. Now you only have to work out how to get through the warp storm without being torn apart by daemonic horrors. Oddgub has a cunning plan though. All the Hulk needs is to be a bit faster. And what goes fastest? “Red wunz.”"/>
<entry name="Orks/Story5BeginningDescription" value="All is ready. The Meks have tested the engines, the hulk has been painted a particularly bloody shade of scarlet, and all the Orks in the Waaagh! believe it's going to work. Now you just have to move the moon-sized ship to a good launch spot for what Oddgub calls the right 'lunch tragedy' and hit the big red button. And tie Wurrrdred to the front for luck.
Bonez sidles up. “Boss, gud news. Da humies and tin'edz and da rest wanna get a lift.” He dodges your fist as you roar “WATT?! ZOG 'EM ALL.” He grins. “'zactly. We're gonna get wun last fight. Figgered you'd like that.” You drop your fist and order your grots to bring your biggest shootaz and choppas and mega armour…"/>
<entry name="SpaceMarines/Story0BeginningDescription" value="As Chapter Master, the arrival of an enormous Ork horde on your Chapter's homeworld was calamitous. But no-one ever said the Adeptus Astartes shirked a challenge. Yet, after months of fighting, the battle remained locked in a stalemate. You instructed the civilian Planetary Governor that Astra Militarum support was required—clearing the green menace was a priority, whatever the blow to the Chapter's pride.
Barely had the guardsmen landed when a system-wide warp storm began, devastating the planet. Of your majestic fleet, a single Battle Barge in low orbit was the sole survivor. When the surface storms calmed, your surviving marines emerged into a ruined world. You are trapped on the planet's surface, cut off from the Imperium, and surrounded by Xenos species to boot. But you are the Emperor's own sons, the Space Marines, and you will not die easily, or in vain!"/>
<entry name="SpaceMarines/Story1BeginningDescription" value="Your Librarians have been suffering endless torments since the storm started, and are now mostly incapacitated—but your chief Librarian has pushed through the pain to stand before you. He reports, through gritted teeth, that the Librarians feel that something unholy accompanied the Astra Militarum here. It's something immensely, dangerously powerful, a void in the warp, and must be destroyed.
His suspicions are infectious. You order the detention of all Astra Militarum forces, but this soon gets out of hand, with your Marines executing Guardsmen on sight. This is not the Astartes way… but if ten thousand innocents must die to save the planet, then the Astartes are the Emperor's tool."/>
<entry name="SpaceMarines/Story4BeginningDescription" value="The Techmarines make their report, impassive. The device is… terrifying. Its destructive power is akin to the Exterminatus action—but this is usually carried out by a fleet of ships, not a gunmetal case a Marine can carry in one hand. More terrifying is its presence on this world—who knows what else might be located in the depths, amongst the Old One ruins, and their abominable creations?
Weak as the Chapter is, you cannot hope to hold this planet, or to prevent the device or the structures from falling into the hands of the old enemy, Chaos. The Chapter council agrees that the device and the planet must destroyed, even at the cost of the Chapter itself. Then the Master of the Forge presents a sliver of hope—that even in death, the Chapters geneseed could be preserved, buried deep beneath the monastery, and hence survive this… Exterminatus device. You order work to begin immediately."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story0BeginningDescription" value="You should not be here. You cannot be here.
Your ship was an ark, carrying the races and ideas of the T'au to new worlds, following Commander Surestrikes fleet. You should be with him and your Fourth Sphere comrades, proselytising the Greater Good to new souls.
Instead, in the Vash'aun'an, the ‘space between the stars, a dream of corruption swallowed the fleet. Your auxiliaries were lost or twisted to darkness. And in that timeless nightmare an impossible many-handed being saved your ship, alone of the fleet. Landed it here. On this guela Hive World, ruined by war, full of hostile aliens and trapped by storms.
As the ranking ShasEl not in stasis, the Ethereal AunDakE has named you Commander. He assigns you a new task—to take this planet for the Tau."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story0Stage1Description" value="Youre studying a dissected Vespid when KorDaron of the Air Caste arrives. His slender frame looms over the body, recoiling a little when he sees the signature deformities—the warped oculi, the unusual patterns grown under the mesoplarum, the oozing tergite.
“It is better dead.” he says, lugubriously, making the hand sign of the dove. “We are lucky we caught it amongst the pack. I am told that our orders say we should eliminate all the Mal'kor—but our scouts report other Vespid out there who do not bear the Mont taint. Would it not be right to at least attempt to bring them back to the Way?” You agree—as they say on Sacea, ‘the Way is always open. And, as you admit to KorDaron honestly, the troops will come in useful. You order the Fire Warriors to prepare their Drones for war."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story1BeginningDescription" value="In your cell, your meditations are interrupted. That familiar cloying scent heralds the first among your arks Ethereals, the ruthless AunDakE.
“Commander, the stars are strange.” says AunDakE. “We are adrift in space and time, and the homeworlds are lost. We may be the last of the Tau.” You feel the truth of what he says.
He turns an iron gaze on you. “So when we requested the elimination of the auxiliaries, it was because we could not afford to gamble. Your actions risked our entire civilization, even if they seemed to bolster the good.” He orders you to purge any auxiliary or Tau that displays any signs of corruption—physical, mental, or spiritual."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story1Stage1Description" value="Carefully, carefully, the Bentusin technicians have manoeuvred the stasis pods from your ark to the colony city. Inside is your most precious treasure—the sleeping forms of your experts and leaders, Engineers, Ethereals, Fireblades and the Commanders.
AunDakE comes to you again. “KorDorans scout drones have identified ancient structures beneath the planets surface. I must investigate this personally. I need to know we can rely on you in our absence. Can we?” His face is impassive, but his hand gestures are hostile, expectant.
You reassure him, your loyalty burning in your eyes, and prepare for his expedition."/> <entry name="Tau/Story1Stage2Description" value="This is the first time since your home on Sacea that you have been without Ethereal guidance. Oddly, your daily meditations on the Good seem somehow richer, more complete. You feel a oneness with all life, even this planets innumerable foes.
Though you know AunDakE has always commanded the use of force first—and now you think how strange that is for someone so committed to the greater good—your inclination is persuasion first. You send the water caste to treat with the human refugees, bringing them to the Way, and bend your efforts to a proper harmony and happiness amongst the various races in your city."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story2EndingDescription" value="Watching her in action through the drone-link, you are so proud of her—of Coldflame. And terrified for her at the same time. It is not accepted by the Tau to express emotion about kin but she is more than that to you—you are both bound by the Ta'lissera, the bonding knife ritual, which is tighter than family.
So when she returns from her campaigns, her Battlesuit ruined and bloodied, you are always waiting for her with the Cadre guard, pride and relief poorly hidden behind the formalities. As ta'lissera, she knows what that means."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story3BeginningDescription" value="Your meditation today was on humility and detachment. When you arose, Coldflame was lounging against your terminal. “Friend, I am proud of you.” she smiles, her hand gestures jocular and warm. “The way of the Tau should not be to shoot first. And dont tell me not to call you ‘friend—the Ethereals arent here and I outrank you, ha. Where are the Ethereals anyway?”
You explain that they are either in the field, in stasis or with AunDakE, investigating the planets secrets. “Well”, she laughs, “I guess we get to work out what the Greater Good is today, hmm? Ive sent the Water Caste diplomats to treat with the human forces—and the survivors tell me that theyve agreed to a deal. If we can eliminate their Mont traitors, well have a truce.”"/>
<entry name="Tau/Story4BeginningDescription" value="AunDakE has returned, with fewer bodyguards and more scars. You can barely follow his boastful tale of his exploits beneath the planets surface, but you understand when he gives the planet a new name—“Muortvaul” or the ‘casque of the anvil.
The Ethereals have even spoken to something intelligent in the depths. The Earth Caste and Bentusin are trying to understand it, but they say that there is an ancient Ar'cea device built throughout the world—placed by the Aeldari or their forebears millennia ago, to restrain a Necron god."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story5BeginningDescription" value="With so few Ethereals to spread calm and so much disorder from the journey here, the Coldflame rebellion spreads quickly. Hers is an open creed, accepting Tau, Guela, the auxiliary races… everyone save for Ethereals who are shot on sight. Their Earth Caste rebels quickly fortify a human settlement.
AunDakE stays with you constantly, reassuring you. “The Gue'senshi-lovers have gathered in one place, Commander. This is your chance to redeem yourself. To kill that traitor, Coldflame.” You look at the bonding knife, strapped to your hip. She is all to you—more than the Tau, perhaps? You hesitate."/>
<entry name="Tau/Story5EndingDescription" value="AunDakE watches with you as Coldflame dies. He tells you that you should be happy, that she was a traitor, that her death clears your name, that you are free from your bonds of oath and fealty. You smile and nod and inside you something breaks.
The Ethereal is gloating. He says youll be able to make use of the technology inside the planet, soon—that this world will become a beacon for the Greater Good. He talks of finally supplanting AunVa. You feel that you cant but be happy for him.
And yet inside your broken bond burns, eating away at your reason. In your meditation, later, you twist your bonding knife over and over, careless of the cuts it inflicts. Away from AunDakE, you can only think of her—her empathy, her courage, her sacrifice. The Coldflame rebellion does not end here."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story0BeginningDescription" value="To: Magos Xenologis Lexidium. Report concerning Divisio Biologis operations on Gladius Prime.
…with the Astra Militarum as tech-priest liaison, to investigate the Circle Varnak facility on Gladius Prime—that is, the successful experiments which had resulted in victory at Fecundia… [missing data]
…when the storm stabilised, the planet was cut off. Fearing the worst, I made my way to the Genetor facility—but found it an empty ruin, with no trace of Servitors or Tech-Priests. I returned empty-handed to the surviving Imperial forces.
Soon, reports came in. Monsters, horrors—Tyranids. Yet the creatures were not coordinated swarms—they were isolated, running wild, easy prey for neophyte Marines or veteran guardsmen. I dared to hope we could eliminate them quickly.
That wish was short-lived."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story1BeginningDescription" value="To: Magos Xenologis Lexidium. Report concerning Divisio Biologis operations on Gladius Prime.
Tech-Adept, I had the data from Fecundia and Macragge, I knew the Tyranid methodology—they would be gathering biomass to mount their assault, stripping isolated areas down to the bedrock for materials and building their armies. And the Hive Mind was a gourmet, sampling the local genetic data, creating warriors tailored to our weaknesses to ensure victory. Even now, I knew the Malanthropes would be massing, working behind the warriors.
I should have warned the Astra Militarum, I know—but I was more concerned with protecting the products of our research. These Tyranids could be the key to defeating the next Hive Fleet. I chose to gather data, in the hope of getting it off planet, and hence I doomed this world."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story2BeginningDescription" value="To: Magos Xenologis Lexidium. Report concerning Divisio Biologis operations on Gladius Prime.
Finally, the Space Marine Chapter and the Astra Militarum realised the threat—that they were trapped here, not merely with Orks and Necrons, but with Tyranids too. That humanity might be crushed between these three Xenos horrors. My remaining flesh ached with despair. Yet an unexpected ally gave us a chance to destroy them once and for all.
Tech-Adept, the planet itself rose up against them.
It seems that Gladius housed some long-forgotten Xenos technology, perhaps the self-same that trapped us here under the warp storms. Great spires of burnished Exodite metal rose from the ground around the Tyranid hives. From my analyses of its remains, I suspect it may pre-date even the Aeldari—as far back as… [data missing]"/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story3BeginningDescription" value="To: Magos Xenologis Lexidium. Report concerning Divisio Biologis operations on Gladius Prime.
With the planet as our ally, we dared to dream—but the human forces couldn't afford to lose another expedition like the last, instead focusing on [data missing]
Thankfully, the planet's ancient mechanisms threw up another trick—a psychic signal akin to that produced by the doomed Astropath on Fecundia which somehow divided the Hive Mind against itself. A second hive arose to fight the first, and a real hope emerged amongst the defenders that the Hive Fleet would spend all its biomass in futile internecine war.
I had no such illusions. I knew that one swarm would prevail and emerge the stronger for the test. That soon the isolated Tyranid strain would call out to space and attract the nearest Hive Fleet—perhaps a fragment of Tiamet—and then all would be consumed."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story3EndingDescription" value="As I predicted, this conflict, far from being an obstacle, was an accelerant for the Tyranids' planetary conquest. Our astropath reported that the hive had created something like a Brood Mind—a psychic beacon strong enough to pass through even the maelstrom above. The Hive Fleet was coming.
For Gladius Prime's loss to mean something, someone needed to survive and pass this data onto the Adeptus Mechanicus. I planned my escape from the planet."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story4BeginningDescription" value="To: Magos Xenologis Lexidium. Report concerning Divisio Biologis operations on Gladius Prime.
Months passed, Tech-Adept. The planet continued to ramp up the pressure on the Xenos, turning the planet's life against them, even as the Shadow in the Warp fell over Gladius Prime and the Hive Fleet encircled it.
We now felt like bystanders in a battle between giants. It must have become obvious to the Hive Mind that it couldn't simply consume this world like normal—their dreaded spore pods couldn't get through the warp storms and they couldn't breed fast enough on the surface to overcome our defenses. It needed something special to crack the planet wide open.
The few Imperial satellites and the Space Marine Battle Barge reported that the hive fleet was circling the planet, throwing mycetic spores downward, probing the storm. Though nothing made it through, the fleet seemed to identify a relatively stable point in the storm. The Shadow In The Warp pushed on it, widening it."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story5BeginningDescription" value="To: Magos Xenologis Lexidium. Report concerning Divisio Biologis operations on Gladius Prime.
Whatever it was that gestated on the planet then, we could all feel the horror of it—even my remaining flesh shrank as the thing grew. At its birth, every psyker on the planet howled—the Hive Mind had sent something monstrous to the planet.
The planet's defences knew that this was the end too—it scraped up everything left to it, every horror driven from its lair and forced towards the Tyranid hives. Orks, Psycheneuin, Catachan Devils, degenerate Kroot. And the Hive Mind defended its gestating horror with equal vigour."/>
<entry name="Tyranids/Story5Stage1Description" value="My attempts to secure an artefact to stabilise the storm and a ship to leave Gladius had been frustrated by the Tyranid arrival and the loss of my Kastelans. Escape from the planet was impossible, I now recognised. In our makeshift fortifications, the Imperial Cult led the prayers to the God-Emperor one last time—and I prayed to the Omnissiah.
Then I organised for my notes to be preserved in the traditional method—buried alongside the Marines' gene-seed in a drill, deep in the planet's crust. And I prepared myself for death.
And out there, in the ruins of our civilisation, the Tyranid creature—the Doom of this planet—crept closer to its destiny, the heart of this strange alien world. Our satellites saw it battling towards the base of a Tower of Vaul—perhaps to access the Exodite mechanisms inside?"/> <entry name="Tyranids/Story5EndingDescription" value="Have you ever felt a planet just… die? We all felt that at the last. Beneath our feet, it trembled. Whatever ancient power had been battling the Tyranids was finally defeated, its psychic energies absorbed by the Tyranid's monstrous creation.
And then it started to come apart. That ancient machine, whatever it was, must have simply been holding the entire planet together—even now the earth shudders constantly beneath our feet, the gravity shifting wildly. If it continues at this rate, the planet will simply disintegrate—denying the Tyranids its resources at least.
I have no idea if this message will survive. I am handing it to my servitor, to send into the planet's crust now—I hope it will survive the collapse of the planet. May the Omnissiah have mercy on our souls."/>
